Plot.
New York photographer Laura Mars latest exhibit, its associated book titled 
Eyes of Mars, and her continuing current work are considered controversial 
for the depiction of female sexuality side by side with violence. Laura has 
been having the occasional vision for several years, which started this 
thematic work. These visions started as fleeting thoughts, which have now 
become full blown moving pictures, as if she were looking through a camera 
lens. These visions begin to haunt her as she can see people she knows in 
these visions, they who end up being murdered by a knife through the eyes, 
the actual murder which she "sees" as it is happening through the eyes of 
the killer. As the police investigate these murders, she tries to explain 
to them her visions. The only one of the investigating detectives who 
believes her is the lead, Lieutenant John Neville. Laura is scared not only 
for her friends and associates, but also herself as she can see in her 
visions that the killer is also after her. As she begins a personal 
relationship with Neville, she comes to the conclusion that the killer 
may not be some random nut who solely dislikes her work, but someone that 
she knows and trusts, the leading candidates being her estranged ex-husband, 
Michael Reisler, who recently re-entered her life, and her driver, Tommy 
Ludlow, who routinely carries a knife and whose criminal past she had only 
recently learned.

Stars.
=>-Faye Dunaway.
=>-Tommy Lee Jones.
=>-Brad Dourif.
